intro: Melochia gracilis, commonly known as slender melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. Melochia gracilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
